title: Moti Gitik
text:
Moti Gitik () is a mathematician, working in <a href="set%20theory">set theory</a>, who is professor at the <a href="Tel-Aviv%20University">Tel-Aviv University</a>. He was an <a href="List%20of%20International%20Congresses%20of%20Mathematicians%20Plenary%20and%20Invited%20Speakers">invited speaker</a> at the 2002 <a href="International%20Congresses%20of%20Mathematicians">International Congresses of Mathematicians</a>, and became a fellow of the <a href="American%20Mathematical%20Society">American Mathematical Society</a> in 2012.
Research.
Gitik proved the <a href="relative%20consistency">consistency</a> of "all uncountable cardinals are <a href="singular%20cardinal">singular</a>" (a strong negation of the <a href="axiom%20of%20choice">axiom of choice</a>) from the consistency of "there is a proper class of <a href="strongly%20compact%20cardinal">strongly compact cardinal</a>s". He further proved the <a href="equiconsistency">equiconsistency</a> of the following statements: 
Gitik discovered several methods for building models of ZFC with complicated Cardinal Arithmetic structure. His main results deal with consistency and equi-consistency of non-trivial patterns  of the Power Function over singular cardinals.
